result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamar Treven Hoffmann in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-5-2022

Defendant Shamar Treven Hoffmann in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-23-2022

Defendant Shamar Treven Hoffmann in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense counsel is in trial on another matter and requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-17-2022

Defendant Shamar Treven Hoffmann in court by video with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask who appears in person.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-7-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving without a valid license.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shamar Treven Hoffmann in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Shamar Treven Hoffmann in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shamar Treven Hoffmann appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
